query.queryString: (/article/relations/categories/collection/code='resultsPack,projectsInfoPack,brief' OR (/result/relations/categories/collection/code='deliverable,publication' OR contenttype='project')) AND ('SUSTAINABILITY' OR 'INNOVATION' OR 'MULTI-CRITERIA')

warnings.message: One of the fields on which a sort was requested does not exist

result.title: Living Lab operation learning refinements and reporting
result.description: D33 specifies concrete quantified measurements indicators which have been taken at the beginning and at the end of the scenario T31 as well as specific conclusions and recommendations This deliverable focuses on the impact of the EuTravels innovative approach from the perspective of the end users travellers the ecosystem participants and other stakeholders authorities technical staff It is meaningful to examine how the approach that EuTravel suggests propagates to the growth of the multimodal travelling domain for the key player businessesAlso this deliverable will report outputs from Plan Do Check Act cyclesConclusions will include promising ideas for further research or innovation and limitations technological political or commercial that could affect the effectiveness of the EuTravels unified Optimodal travelling concept

project.title: Optimodal European Travel Ecosystem

result.title: Design Options Paper,
result.description: The Design Option Paper identifies and documents the implementation options, guidelines and enactment alternatives that the partners in the challenge have experienced and would recommend to an agency which is interested in implementing the proposed practice (startup softlanding programme). Through an interactive process supported by the involvement of an expert, partners will contribute and tune the leanings collected in the Crossregional Softlanding Programme Design Option Paper . IRP and FINN will coordinate together this task which is the core element of the project. All other partners will provide feedbacks and recommendations to realize the final version to be presented during one of the Alpe Adria Startup events (Podim, Startup Weekend, Business Angels events).

result.title: Completion of at least 42% of 260 modules (background chapters and 15 virtual reality 3D environments)
result.description:
Completion of: - 42% of the modules, each consisting of background chapters on Anatomy, Preoperative and Postoperative, which will be uploaded in the INCISION Academy 0.5 for demonstration. - 15 virtual reality environment, which will be viewable on smartphones & integrated in a INCISION Film.
Chapters are uploaded into the INCISION Academy 0.5. Additionally an overview of completed modules will be included in a deliverable report to the EC.
This deliverable is related to Tasks 3.1, 3.2, 3.3, 3.4 and 3.5.

result.title: Completion of at least 15% of 260 modules (background chapters and 1 virtual reality 3D environment)
result.description:
Completion of: - 15% of the modules, each consisting of background chapters on Anatomy, Preoperative and Postoperative, which will be uploaded in the old INCISION Academy for demonstration. - 1 virtual reality environment, which will be viewable on smartphones & integrated in a INCISION Film.
Chapters are uploaded into the old INCISION Academy and will be available for viewing. Additionally an overview of completed modules will be included in a deliverable report to the EC.
This deliverable is related to Tasks 3.1, 3.2, 3.3 and 3.5.

result.title: Completion of at least 15% of 260 modules
result.description: Completion of at least 15% of the anticipated modules, consisting of a written step-by-step approach and a 2D and 3D video. We will provide a deliverable report and access to the updated INCISION academy (beta version) that will host the various modules for demonstration. This deliverable is related to Tasks 2.1, 2.2 and 2.3.

result.title: Prototype of the INCISION Academy 1.0
result.description:
Prototype of the INCISION Academy 1.0 with the following extra features over the 0.5 version: - Personalized Courses - CME link compatible - DRM - Accessible from tablets - 140 modules online (from WP2/3)
We will provide a deliverable report to the EC and enable online demonstration.
This deliverable is related to Task 5.2.

result.title: Public Wiki Page
result.description: a Wiki page, public, maximising the outreach of the project; the public Wiki page has to be established within month 12 and constantly updated. The Wiki page should keep track of new appointments of the personnel (students of temporary researchers) that left the Member Institutions to join other Academic Institutions or Industries, stressing the contribution to their careers coming from the activities performed and the skills acquired within the framework of the project

result.title: D5.2 Semi-Automated Traffic Analysis of Encrypted Network Traffic
result.description: This deliverable will describe a semi-automated tool to assess the degree of protection offered by privacy-friendly communication techniques (especially anonymisation methods based on onion routing) and a proposal how to improve the level of protection offered by state-of-the-art privacy-friendly communication techniques while minimising communication overhead.
